reviews.title: Full of character
reviews.text: Excellent food, friendly but somewhat slow service since we were the last to arrive in the restaurant. We wouldn't hesitate to return.

reviews.title: A great place to celebrate a special birthday.
reviews.text: I was absolutely delighted with everything, from the planning of it to their attention to detail on the day. We had a cold buffet and were meant to be there at 1pm but after running late at the nearby clay pigeon shoot we arrived at 2.15pm to a warm welcome. Everybody in our party commented on how good the food was and what a lovely venue. We had the room at the back of the inn which was great for us and when two people turned up unexpectantly chairs were provided for them. Quite a few of the party would have liked to have stayed longer and sample more of their fantastic selection of wines and whiskies! I would definitely return here for another special occasion.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The evening meal was booked for our anniversary. The reason we chose the Nobody Inn - recommendations from others and I promise you it will not disappoint. Would have liked to stay in one of their rooms but alas being as popular as they are there was no room at the inn! We stayed at Town Barton which in itself was a treat and very close to the Nobody Inn. We were greeted at the inn by friendly staff who continued to look after us throughout the evening. The food we had was cooked to order and service was very prompt. Every course from starter to dessert was delicious and exactly as the menu described. The food was accompanied by lovely wine which we had selected from a very comprehensive wine list and the evening was topped off with a delightful malt whisky from their range of over 240 (it has to be seen to be believed). The knowledge of the staff with regard to their drinks range is exceptional. In value for money terms I could not praise this inn highly enough. Just to make sure, we had booked in for breakfast the following morning and again they didn't disappoint, lovely welcome and all the food was freshly prepared and piping hot where appropriate. Needless to say we will be visiting again some time in the future and in the meantime we will be spreading the word to encourage family members and friends to visit if they are looking for a real treat.
reviews.title: What a fantastic evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent food, service and selection of wines and whiskeys. staff extremely helpful and friendly. Room 5 slightly on the small side however spotlessly clean, comfortable and with added touches. Excellent value for the service provided. Dogs made welcome in the bar area. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: The nobody Inn
The "Nobody" should be full!
reviews.text: Hadn't been there for at least fifteen years. New owners about four years ago have not harmed its rustic charm, warm welcome, comfortable rooms, good food, thoughtful wine list, choice of over 100 malt whiskies, exceptionally helpful and friendly staff.

reviews.title: Can't wait to return!
reviews.text: We stayed at The Nobody Inn for 2 nights, once we had found our way we were so pleased as it was exactly what we were expecting. Set in a beautiful little village, walking in to a real old pub with a friendly welcome.
Our room No.5 was lovely, nicely decorated & even an elephant on the bed made from fresh towels & complimentary sherry.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT VALUE, Tiny Niggle

reviews.text: We were hoping for the room with the 4 poster bed... But our fault for not asking when we booked.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a table in the restaurant both nights & the food was delicious... All 3 courses! Great wine menu, over 200 to chose from. We're not whiskey drinkers but had to try one of the 240 on offer, the bar man was so helpful & recommended 2 to try- both very nice.
reviews.title: Great welcome, superb food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic stay & will definitely be returning, great place, great location & lovely staff
reviews.title: Friendly welcome, brilliant food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Nobody Inn is one of those places that was very high on my places to stay list and considering it is not to many miles from where I live I dont know why I hav'nt been here before.
reviews.title: Dont make any changes

reviews.text: Well my wife had booked us a room as a suprise for my Birthday on Friday 6th july. Stepping through the door was like going back in time with none of the modern false made to look old bars like a lot of pub chains do these days this place is very very original and the welcome from the lady behind the bar made me proud to be from Devon myself. The bar has all of its original features with low beamed ceilings stained glass windows inglenook fireplace lovely old furniture and the most amazing stocked whisky (over 200) and wine ( over100) Bar with a good selection of ales. You must try a bowl of their roasted Broad Beans as a snack delicious. We both Shared a very nice ploughmans for our lunch which was served on a piece of slate very different. After a couple of drinks we were shown our room which was very clean low ceilings and laid out to a very high standard. There was even a caraff of sherry on the side which was excellant. The onsuite was modern with a good shower cubicle and good toiletries. when settled in we went for a walk to the church and could see why Cromwells men couldn't find it well worth a visit. We had our evening meal in the restaurant which was great nice setting/service and excellant food then into the bar to sample a few whiskys the knowledge of the barman regarding whisky was very good for someone so young. The bed was very comfortable which gave us a good nights sleep and breakfast in the morning was excellant. We will definatly be staying again just please dont change a thing!!! keep it as it is well done.
reviews.title: Only Ate (didn't stay) but Loved It - worth hunting it out

reviews.text: We bumped into some friends who were staying (and said it was great!) and joined them for dinner the night after our wedding in Cornwall. There was a very drunken and disorderly man trying to ask for the manager's hand in marriage (she politely declined the offer!) but he was soon ushered out and everybody turned back to their tables. Tables were shifted around so that the 4 of us could sit together. I had a delicious panfried calves liver, perfectly cooked. My husband had proper fish and chips, again delicious. They have over 260 whiskeys stacked behind the bar which makes for a great look and an interesting tipple if you feel like it. It's a proper pub with great grub. Make the effort to find it, it's worth it.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent last night at The Nobody Inn, on a business trip to the area, what a pleasant suprise, made me very welcome, great breakfast and lovely room. Didnt get to try the dinner, so guess I will have to go back!
reviews.title: " What a gem"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent six nights at this gem of an Inn,bags of charm,excellent food,Sue,and her staff did everything possible to make our,300 mile journey worth while,and boy,they sure succeded.
reviews.title: A perfect little bolt hole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night on our return journey from Cornwall. We were welcomed and shown to our room (No.1). This was an irregularly shaped room as the shower room took up one corner. Room was fine but we felt the bed was rather on the small side compared with others on this trip. The shower room might have been a hazard for tall guests but had everything needed. We laughed at the elephant arrangement of towels on the bed.
reviews.title: Devon Inn tucked away
Little Gem
reviews.text: As we had eaten well during our holiday, we had a light bar meal. Service was attentive. My husband's baked trout was delicious and I enjoyed a superb ploughmans of ham, cheese, quail scotch egg, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked for an 8.15am breakfast as we wanted to make an prompt start. Another guest had to chase the kitchen staff at 8.20 as he had a plane to catch. A third guest had to ask for butter as none had been provided for any table. I enjoyed a fruit platter but my husband felt his cooked breakfast compared with less favourably with those at our B&B in Cornwall. We felt the breakfast service was less organised than that of the previous evening. If a breakfast time is offered, then staff should be ready to serve at that time.
reviews.title: Romantic retreat in Devon

reviews.text: A great real ale pub with fantastic accommodation. It's tucked away but well worth seeking out, the food and accommodation are excellent and with over 240 whiskies and 200 wines on offer it makes for a great night out. Stayed in the accommodation twice and hope to go back again soon.
reviews.title: Lovely place with sunny garden

reviews.text: What an absolute delight. Fantastic food, wonderful, clean rooms, remote and beautiful location. Recommend to anyone. We were staying two nights and decided before hand to eat somewhere different on the second night. The food was so good that we ate there second night too. Exquisite.
reviews.title: A great local pub
